72 Hours In Los Angeles Flip Grid

  • 72

  • LAX AIRPORT

    Westchester

    The world's fourth-busiest airport

    rolled out new rules for pickups

    just days before we arrived.

  • HOURS

  • Barnsdall Art Park

    East Hollywood

    Black wings were found in the city

    of angles as Halloween decorations

    started coming down too.

    • Y-Que Trading Post

      Los Feliz

      You can design your own shirts

      at this groovy souvenir shop

      beloved by locals and tourists alike.

    • IN

    • 7th St / Metro Center

      Financial District

      Metro's Blue Line reopened as the A Line

      on Nov. 2. The light rail line offers service

      to the Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum.

    • LOS ANGELES

      • Bradbury Building

        Downtown Los Angeles

        The 1982 film Blade Runner was set

        in November 2019 and filmed here.

        The future has arrived.

      • LTSC

        Little Tokyo

        The Little Tokyo Service Center is

        a social and cultural welfare instition

        on the edge of Skid Row.

      • Angel City Brewery

        Arts District

        Bartenders at this leading L.A. brewery

        had great recommendations for on-tap beer

        as well as that within walking distance.

      • Umgee USA Inc

        Pico Gardens

        Waste disposal company NASA Services

        has been blamed for the 38% increase

        in nearby homeowners’ trash bills.

        • Sixth Street Bridge

          Boyle Heights

          Completion of the largest bridge project

          in LA history has been delayed

          until March 2022.

        • Mel’s Drive-In

          West Hollywood

          Actor, bodybuilder and former California

          Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger recently

          revealed that his diet is now 99% vegan.

        • The Comedy Store

          West Hollywood

          John Witherspoon was honored at the club

          where he honed his craft. The beloved

          actor-comedian died on Oct. 29 at age 77.

        • Venice Afterburn

          Venice Beach

          Large scale sculptures sat on the beach

          during the official Regional Burning Man

          event hosted by the Venice Art Crawl.

          • Sunset Boulevard

            Silver Lake

            Homeless encampments lined the highway

            above million dollar homes; evidence

            of the city's growing wealth gap.

          • VanillaBlack

            Echo Park

            Neon lights faded more with

            every step further as night

            fell on Sunset Boulevard.

          • Guisados

            Echo Park

            This Boyle Heights-born Mexican

            restaurant serves meats, vegetables and

            seafood in fresh homemade tortillas.

          • Grand Park

            Downtown Los Angeles

            Community center Self Help Graphics

            & Art celebrated Day of the Dead with

            festive altars that lit up the plaza.

            • Yang Chow Restaurant

              Chinatown

              Five brothers started this family-run staple

              here in 1977. Named after their hometown,

              Yang Chow now has multiple locations.

            • Pacific Park

              Santa Monica

              We cruised the boardwalk

              Monday morning, hours before

              our flight back to New York.

            • Massilia

              Downtown Santa Monica

              The founder of French micro-chain

              Zinqué cafe has brought new life to

              Border Grill's shuttered promenade spot.

            • Misfits Bar

              Downtown Santa Monica

              A patron’s print pays homage to Capone

              and Noriega’s The War Report. The 1997

              album features the single “L.A., L.A.”
